page.title: 18Ringo Starr
page.content: When we were doing our street survey we found out that Ringo Starr was born in Madryn Street. Ringo's real name was Richard Starkey and he became a drummer with the Beatles pop group. Ringo was born on 7th July 1940, and he was nicknamed Ringo because he wore so many rings on his fingers. He changed his surname because he thought that Starkey was too long to be easily remembered. The other members of the Beatles were George Harrison, Paul McCartney and John Lennon. From 1963 to 1971 the Beatles sold millions of records throughout the world. Lennon and McCartney wrote many well known songs such as "Yellow Submarine" "She Loves You" and "Yesterday". In 1971 the Beatles decided to split up and follow solo careers. Ringo decided he would become an actor and he has been in many films.
